Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 208,.proposition: The Plaintiff, Jessica Thompson, brings this Complaint for Modification seeking a change in the current custody arrangement with the Defendant, Michael Thompson, concerning their children, Emma Thompson (10) and Noah Thompson (8), pursuant to Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 208, Section 28.

Doe v. Roe, 123 Mass. App. Ct. 456 (2018.raw_text: Doe v. Roe, 123 Mass. App. Ct. 456 (2018)
Doe v. Roe, 123 Mass. App. Ct. 456 (2018.proposition: Pursuant to Massachusetts law, a custody order may be modified upon a showing of a material change in circumstances which warrants such modification.

Smith v. Johnson, 309 Mass. 123 (2005).proposition: Pursuant to Massachusetts law, a custody order may be modified upon a showing of a material change in circumstances which warrants such modification.
Smith v. Johnson, 309 Mass. 123 (2005).support_reasoning: The opinion concerns intestate succession and the legitimacy of a child based on the validity of a prior marriage, not child custody or modification of custody orders. It does not discuss standards for modifying custody, material changes in circumstances, or any related family-law custody doctrine under Massachusetts law. Therefore, it does not provide authority for the claimed proposition.
Smith v. Johnson, 309 Mass. 123 (2005).relevant_excerpt: A ceremony of marriage has the technical effect, either of prima facie evidence of its validity, or of casting the burden of proof upon the party denying its validity. Vergnani v. Guidetti, 308 Mass. 450, 454, 455. But where there are two successive ceremonial marriages of the same man to different women, it is at least doubtful whether any technical effect is given to the second one by assuming the dissolution of the first one.

In re Custody of Brown, 456 Mass. 789 (2.raw_text: In re Custody of Brown, 456 Mass. 789 (2012)
In re Custody of Brown, 456 Mass. 789 (2.proposition: Pursuant to Massachusetts law, a custody order may be modified upon a showing of a material change in circumstances which warrants such modification.
In re Custody of Brown, 456 Mass. 789 (2.support_reasoning: The provided opinion concerns a murder conviction, a motion for a new trial, and related ineffective assistance and prosecutorial error claims. It does not address family law, custody, or standards for modifying custody orders, nor does it discuss any requirement of a material change in circumstances. Therefore, it cannot be cited as authority for the Massachusetts custody‑modification standard described in the proposition.

Johnson v. Thompson, 456 Mass. 567 (2010.proposition: Pursuant to Massachusetts law, a custody order may be modified upon a showing of a material change in circumstances which warrants such modification.
Johnson v. Thompson, 456 Mass. 567 (2010.case_name: T.W. Nickerson, Inc. v. Fleet National Bank
Johnson v. Thompson, 456 Mass. 567 (2010.support_reasoning: This opinion concerns contractual rights under commercial leases, implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, trust termination, and Chapter 93A. It does not address family law, custody orders, or modification standards, nor does it mention a “material change in circumstances” test for custody. Therefore it cannot be cited as authority for the Massachusetts standard for modifying custody orders.
